title: American_top_40_February_9th,_1974
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

Casey answers the question, "Who has spent the most consecutive weeks in the top 40?"
Since numbers 4 and 24 are the same song, Casey skips playing number 24.
Casey answers the question, "Which act in the rock era has had the most double-sided hits: that is, where both sides of a single 45 RPM made the charts?"

40: Come and Get Your Love - Redbone
39: I'd Like To Live The Love - B.B. King
38: I Shall Sing - Art Garfunkel
37: Helen Wheels - Paul McCartney And Wings
Extra: I Want To Hold Your Hand - Beatles 10th Anniversary (Not included in this rebroadcast)

29: Baby Come Close - Smokey Robinson
28: Me and Baby Brother - War
27: Seasons in The Sun - Terry Jacks
26: Jim Dandy - Black Oak Arkansas
25: The Most Beautiful Girl - Charlie Rich
24: The Americans - Gordon Sinclair (Skipped By Casey For #4)
